column4: Hi, I just managed to set up and connect with my wireless card. However I am experiencing some results which lead me to think things might not be perfect. Basically I can connect to reddit.com (which is very simple pretty much text only - so small as well). However when I try to connect to Mozilla Thunderbird site or CNN the pageload fails half way through. Finally, I can connect to cnn or thunderbird sites with my XP computer at the same time so I don'
t think those pages/sites are down. Any thoughts?
when you say the page load fails, what *exactly* happens?

barbarella_me, I'm using firefox. I was attempting to download thunderbird and noticed the page load problem. What is happening is that when I try to access the thunderbird website (or cnn) the status bar just says "looking up www.mozilla.com" for a LONG LONG time.
me? wrt signal strength? I'll see if I can figure that out?
actually, you said it worked in XP
is that with the same card on the same machine in the same place?
oh, of course, you should try using a wired connection, just to make sure it *is* the wireless link that's the problem

yes it worked with my XP computer. The card is not the same. My XP has a built in wireless "card". My Ubuntu installed laptop has an external wireless card. Finally when I hook up the Ubuntu physically to the net (wired connection) there isn't an issue.
assuming you're fairly close to the wireless AP, you can probably rule out signal strength ;-)
Yes I don't think it is signal strength. Wireless Assistant gives link quality 6 gold stars.
I don't know, could be a problem with the card - some aren't well supported
could be something daft like a bad DNS
its a common chipset, I figured that out a while back, just trying to find my notes.
its a RalinkRT2500 chipset. I've been using the following (among others) as reference during the setup:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/RalinkRT2500
would bad DNS screw up my wireless but not wired connection?
